alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 4:30AM EDT until May 08 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of western West Virginia, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wayne, Beech Fork State Park, Fort Gay, East Lynn Lake, Kiahsville, Dunlow, Centerville, Genoa, East Lynn, Lavalette and Wilsondale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
